meanings.definition: A unit of pressure equal to one newton per square meter.
meanings.sent1: The tire pressure was measured in pascals.
meanings.sent2: The weather report mentioned the pressure in pascals.
meanings.sent3: The balloon popped because it couldn't handle the pascal.
meanings.sent4: The pascal of stress in the room was palpable.
meanings.sent5: He felt the weight of the pascal on his shoulders.

meanings.definition: The SI unit of pressure, equal to one newton per square meter.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use pascals to measure pressure accurately.
meanings.sent2: The scuba diver checked the depth in pascals.
meanings.sent3: The soda can exploded due to the high pascal inside.
meanings.sent4: The pascal of anticipation filled the room before the announcement.
meanings.sent5: She could sense the tension in the air, like a heavy pascal.

meanings.definition: A programming language designed for teaching programming and computer science concepts.
meanings.sent1: Students learn coding using pascal in class.
meanings.sent2: The textbook explained the basics of pascal programming.
meanings.sent3: The robot spoke in pascal, confusing the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a complex pascal, solving problems effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The pascal of logic guided his every keystroke.
